qas.question: What number doubled during Paul Vi's papacy?
Who did Paul Vi want to maintain a continuing dialogue with?
What document states that the Catholic church is not subject to any particlar government?
Who did the church retain the right to elect without interference from the state in its constitutional document?
What organization officially outlined the church's relationship to state?

context: Like his predecessor Pius XII, Paul VI put much emphasis on the dialogue with all <a1_0>nations<a1_0/> of the world through establishing diplomatic relations. The number of <a0_0>foreign embassies<a0_0/> accredited to the Vatican doubled during his pontificate. This was a reflection of a new understanding between Church and State, which had been formulated first by Pius XI and Pius XII but decreed by <a4_0>Vatican II<a4_0/>. The pastoral constitution <a2_0>Gaudium et spes<a2_0/> stated that the Catholic Church is not bound to any form of government and willing to cooperate with all forms. The Church maintained its right to select <a3_0>bishops<a3_0/> on its own without any interference by the State.
